snippet: A federal appeals panel on Monday heard the state’s argument against a 2014 ruling that could bring a reprieve to all the inmates on death row in California.
abstract: California requests federal appeals panel to overturn 2014 court ruling that could bring reprieve to more than 740 death row inmates in state; ruling, if permitted to stand, could have consequences for capital punishment nationwide.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals panel on Monday heard the state’s argument against a 2014 ruling that could bring a reprieve to all the inmates on death row in California.

headline.main: California Defends Its Review Process in Appeal to Preserve Death Penalty
headline.print_headline: California Defends Review Process in Death Penalty Cases
